newsitem.title: USA: Mace chairman, two others in voting pact.
newsitem.headline: Mace chairman, two others in voting pact.

text.p: Mace Security International Inc said Monday three of its board members have disclosed that they have entered a voting pact covering more than 50 percent of the company's outstanding stock.
The members include Chairman Jon Goodrich, who has a 29.2 percent stake on the company, and director Robert Gould, who has a 27 percent stake.
The company had said in August that some of its top executives were negotiating a sale of their stakes, which represent a controlling interest in the company, to a competitor.
The company did not immediately return calls for further comment.

Mace said additionally that five board members, including company president Robert Norman, have resigned. It said Norman is being replaced by Marvin Brown, a former executive for a New York-based investment group.
